page.title: 16VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: A survey of the village was carried out by top Juniors from Englefield School. Their findings showed that almost every household contained a telephone. There is also one public telephone in the village. Two daily postal deliveries are made in Englefield and collections made from the three post-boxes at 09:00 and 16:45. These post-boxes are all Elizabethan and free standing. They are situated at Parker's Corner, near Chalkpit Cottages and outside the village post-office. The post-office offers a variety of services including stamps, postal orders, savings, Giro Bank, licences, paying out pensions and family allowances. The post-office and shop also serve as a central place in village life passing on information and providing a place to meet. Papers, milk and groceries are picked up here.
